meanings.sent1: I mistend the instructions and ended up doing it wrong.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes, people mistend what others are trying to say.
meanings.sent3: When I mistend the joke, I laughed at the wrong part.
meanings.sent4: Her tone of voice made it easy to mistend her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The foggy glasses made me mistend the sign for the exit.

meanings.sent1: I always mistend the time it takes to get ready in the morning.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to mistend the distance when looking at a map.
meanings.sent3: I mistend the weight of the package and almost dropped it.
meanings.sent4: She tends to mistend people's intentions, leading to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The mirage in the desert can mistend the actual distance to water.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake in understanding or perception.
meanings.sent1: I mistend the plot of the movie and was confused throughout.
meanings.sent2: It's common to mistend someone's emotions based on their facial expressions.
meanings.sent3: The optical illusion made me mistend the size of the room.
meanings.sent4: His tiredness caused him to mistend the time and miss the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The camouflage pattern can mistend the shape of the object it covers.
